channel.title: Client.jar permissions
channel.description:
With the permissions set to allow file "read", my webclient works fine, but It isn't fine that a user can just go to www.mydomain.com/webclient.client.jar and download my client.
How do I allow the client.jar file to be able to be "read" but not "downloadable"?

item.title: Client.jar permissions
item.dc:creator: @killemquick0 killemquick0
item.description:
@killemquick0 wrote:

Daginith:

Block the url from being accessed?

The only way to do that that I am aware of is changing the permissions of the actual client.jar file. There must be another way. I saw someone speak of a dropbox method, placing the location of the dropbox download link in the html on your website. The dropbox link contains the client.jar.

Still not sure if people would be able to find the dropbox link with that method or not though. =\

EDIT: i just renamed my client.jar to something like 11kIkjH983kL3jED.jar xDD

This might just work.

Read full topic
